summary: This is an email chain from February 2021 regarding therapy sessions for victims of Jeffrey Epstein, coordinated by attorney Jessica Arbour. It discusses eligibility for FBI-funded therapy for two victims and mentions their legal representation.

persons.name: Jessica Arbour
persons.context: Attorney of counsel at Horowitz Law, coordinating therapy sessions for victims and inquiring about FBI-funded therapy eligibility.

persons.name: Lisheyna Hurvitz
persons.context: Therapist mentioned as treating one victim, and another victim plans to see her.

connections.description: Attorney Arbour is coordinating for a victim to see therapist Hurvitz.

events.title: Therapy Coordination for Victims
events.description: Attorney Jessica Arbour inquires about FBI-funded therapy sessions for two victims of Jeffrey Epstein, confirming eligibility and scheduling.

keyFacts: The FBI had a program funding 12 therapy sessions for victims of Jeffrey Epstein as of February 2021.
Attorney Jessica Arbour of Horowitz Law was representing at least two victims and coordinating their therapy.
One victim was planning to see therapist Lisheyna Hurvitz, who was also treating another victim.
The email indicates victims were identified in Palm Beach Police Department (PBPD) reports and were known to the FBI.
